abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Tax Administration
            Institutional Development Project for Mexico is to improve
            tax compliance and reduce evasion of internal national taxes
            to increase government revenues by increasing the efficiency
            and effectiveness of the Government's Tax
            Administration Service (SAT). There are seven project
            components. The first component supports better taxpayer
            service by simplifying tax return filing using more advanced
            electronic means, upgrading taxpayer surveys, creating
            permanent focus groups, carrying out studies, and
            establishing service standards. The second component
            improves management by assessing SAT's staff,
            documenting the results in a Human Resource Management
            System, upgrading training, and introducing performance
            management policies and systems. The third component
            established an information hub by appointing a Chief
            Information Officer and implementing a series of databases
            that will be optimized for access and security. The fourth
            component finances consulting assistance to devleop an
            information and communication technology strategy aligned
            with SAT's business strategy and goals, develops
            strategies for information security and integrity, and
            introduces more efficient automated administrative systems.
            The fifth component supports the compliance process. The
            sixth component supports compliance control and enforcement.
            The seventh component supports strategic planning and
            quality control.
